website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for those wanting larger collapsible bottles for hiking and filtering water.
pros: Includes two heavy-duty carabiners for easy access
Built to attach to and filter water through a Survivor Filter
cons: Survivor filter does not come with collapsible water bottle purchase

customer_reviews.title: Durable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are 33 oz., they are the perfect size. I used one for dirty water to put through my filter and one for clean. I have rolled up, smashed up, and squeezed on the dirty one over 3 different backpacking trips now. It is still going strong! The spout fit right on my sawyer filter perfectly. I was worried to pop it but that doesn't appear to be happening anytime soon. They come with the carabiners too which was nice. Impressive canteens!
customer_reviews.author: jamiex110

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several of these for myself, my husband, and my adult daughter. The bottles worked ok for the first couple of hikes, but there's nothing quite as disappointing as opening your pack on a hike to find that your water bottle has a leak. Thankfully on this particular outing there was plenty of water to refill my other bottle. I have been on hikes that this loss would have been devastating! I cannot recommend these, wishing I could give zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice VanSlyke

customer_reviews.title: Won't fill when submerged
customer_reviews.text: So, okay. I took these along on a hiking trip as a means of getting water from standing water sources in case water from a flowing source (like a spring or a stream) was not available. When I submerged the canteen into standing water, the pressure from the water on the outside walls of the canteen prevented the canteen from opening up enough to allow water to enter. My mistake to buy, but would have appreciated Survivor Filter saying: "Hey kids, just remember, these don't really work well when submerged in water."
customer_reviews.author: C Medders

customer_reviews.title: to keep trash off of the sputs and they do pretty well. One of them didn't want to stay ...
customer_reviews.text: The "Collapsible Canteens" took up very little room in my backpack and I didn't have any problems with any leaking, while I used them at the camping site. I hung them on the side of a tree, to serve as my filtered water holders. The have pop off spout covers, to keep trash off of the sputs and they do pretty well. One of them didn't want to stay in place as well as the other, but they served the purpose... You Could connect them to your side and when finished, fold them up and put them into your pouch, or large pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lee

customer_reviews.title: It broke on first day on the CT!
customer_reviews.text: The collapsible canteens broke on first day on the Colorado Trail (CT). It broke at the body contact with the nozzle/mouth piece. So, I switched to my second one. Well, it also broke that night. The second one broke at the same location as the first one broke. That tells me that it is poor material/plastic. Luckily, one of the scout has a spare platypus collapsible.
customer_reviews.author: Bigbend

customer_reviews.title: Platypus, please go back to your original design!
customer_reviews.text: Platypus, please go back to your original design! I searched everywhere for replacements for my beloved Platy 1L bottles (which I have used throughout the year, for years). Sadly, they stopped making them with handles. These feel like cheaper quality and they are. Akin to the ones for a couple of bucks at WalMart. Still better than a hard water bottle (especially for plane travel), but nowhere near as good as Platypus.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Hold water and will stand when place down. Bad part, top is cheap and not secure.
customer_reviews.text: If you keep your bottle upright, then ok. Do not trust it to lay flat or you will get leaks. Top of bottle is really cheap, may need to find another bottle top to replace unit. When not in use, fold nicely, but the top needs a better system. Otherwise would be 4-5 stars. Hopefully it will last, otherwise will need to return. So can't really recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: miles2121

customer_reviews.title: Leaks For Days!
customer_reviews.text: Awful. They constantly leak. When they're all the we closed, they leak from the spout. When I'm drinking, they leak from the neck. Had to throw one out. I'll keep the other for when I'm desperate. I did like how they held more than 20oz though but that's all I can say that's good.
customer_reviews.author: Artoria Q.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used different brands that lasted well past the 3 times I used one bottle. The clip broke about a mile into the first use walking. Today I dropped the bottle, my fault I know, but it leaked and now I can just throw it away. Good thing it came in a two pack.. UPDATE. I babied the second bottle. The clip broke the second time out. Today, less than three months later, the bag started leaking. Again. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Jakubek

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. Was very excited to get this product. Thank goodness I filled it up the day before our hike and left it in my pack. Several hours later, I went to put other items in the pack and realized my pack was soaking wet. Both canteens had fallen over in the pack and proceeded to leak from the threads of the caps. They were both closed tight and the tops were not open. Bummer. Now I have to return it.
customer_reviews.author: angelaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pack and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can store these in my pack with a very small size or weight penalty. When I think it may be a while before my next source of water they are easy to fill and store. I like the clip as it allows me to attach the bottle to my pack without worry of it falling out or shifting during the tough parts of the trail. Caps a re secure and no leaks yet.
customer_reviews.author: Randy S.

customer_reviews.title: They look sturdy and work well so far
customer_reviews.text: I only just got these, but filled them up and put some pressure on them. They look sturdy and work well so far; however, I really had to tighten the cap, almost more than you'd think reasonable to prevent leaking through the threads. I'd give a 4.5 star rating for that, so after some abuse, I might update to five stars because it's not that big of a deal, but I am concerned that tightening it that much will reduce durability. I thought about using teflon tape for the threads cuz I have plenty, but then what? I doubt the tape will stay on after repeated uses.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic canteens
customer_reviews.text: I take these with me on every hiking/backpacking/camping trip. They are very durable, easy to clean, and pack away very easily. I will fill them with water when I leave the house, and once I've emptied them, I just roll them up and tuck them in one of my backpack's pockets. I've used these as squeeze bottles with a Sawyer Mini to refill a couple of Smart Water bottles as well, and they're great for that. These are actually one of my favorite hiking purchases I've made. They're well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bowles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I used the Platypus on my trip last September and they leaked. Also after cleaning they don't stay opened to dry.So I decided to give these a try and what a difference. I had them in the cooler then in my pack.I was doing slot canyons so the pack was on and off a lot and getting dropped and bounced around,not one leak.After cleaning these easily stay popped open to air dry. I would buy again,i didn't realize these came 2 to a pack so I ended up getting extra.
customer_reviews.author: Ian S.

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: They're ok, but the caps arent secure and screw top doesnt take much to unscrew. After using, will be looking for a better option. When using these, ill be keeping duct tape wrapped around the screw top. Would have liked to see a better design for something people will be using in various situations outdoors. I use mine for caving and need to trust the caps to stay put and the tops to stay on.
customer_reviews.author: agp99

customer_reviews.title: are pretty durable, and hold a decent amount of water
customer_reviews.text: The caps leak a little, but for me that isn't a big issue. These pack down very small, are pretty durable, and hold a decent amount of water. Pros: - Can drink super, super fast from them by squeezing :) - Carabiner is really handy - Compress down to almost nothing Cons: - Leaking caps (your mileage may vary, but both of mine leaked drop by drop when filled and turned upside-down) - Not the easiest to clean
customer_reviews.author: Luc Iyer

customer_reviews.title: I'm surviving.
customer_reviews.text: Careful how you hold it or where you squeeze when it's open because you'll find it easily pumps out the water. Besides that I can't really find something really worth complaining about that I would suggest not buying.. It's made from a durable plastic and I didn't notice much a smell, but you should wash it and rinse through prior to the first use. Design-wise, I hate the clear cap used to cover the mouthpiece because I know I'll lose it eventually, however it's the same size used on other disposable water bottles so it will be easy to replace. Blah blah blah.. buy it! It comes with 2!
customer_reviews.author: Rowley

customer_reviews.title: It works with a Sawyer Mini
customer_reviews.text: I recently order these collapsible canteens and they are great! I know that Survivor Filter has their own line of water filters, but I have been using Sawyer for years. I really like the fact that the Sawyer mini will thread right on. the seams appear to be well put together and well made. I also like that the carbine eye is very thick and looks as if it will hold up. If I had to make a change to the canteen, I would maybe add another eye on the bottom so that it could be hung upside down to drain through the filter to a 2nd container.
customer_reviews.author: Lance B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, collapse completely, no offending smell or taste
customer_reviews.text: The bags are sturdily constructed, stand upright when filled with liquid and collapse completely when empty. The spouts function well and the carabiners allow attachment to a backpack if the backpack has no water pockets. The plastic has no smell and does not affect the taste of water. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Slimjim

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I use these in conjunction with a Sawyer water filter and bag. The Sawyer bag I use with the "dirty" water and squeeze it down into the Survivor bags which carry all the clean water. The Survivor bags are much sturdier and can be used for gravity filtering, or just carrying the clean water. They are much lighter than a metal canteen and take up much less room full or empty.
customer_reviews.author: Whomp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dog. 4 total to place in his backpack. They work great and most importantly do not leak even with jostling. As a bonus it’s back up water for me and my Sawyer mini filter threads onto them. Minimal vessel with apparent great durability. Will update review if they fail prematurely.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Iannotti

customer_reviews.title: Way too hard to open and close.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic caps & nozzle are very hard to open / close so they kill your hands opening them and leak unless you really jam them closed. UPDATE: After a day’s use they nozzles loosened up so they’re not so bad anymore. Still could be better, maybe with a softer plastic, but good enough for how often I’ll use them.
customer_reviews.author: Stoffer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable and convenient, rolls down to very small size when not in use
customer_reviews.text: Have had these collapsible canteens for years. Originally purchased for trip to Ecuador several years ago. (Purchased without filter, as hotels had filtered water.) But have used ever since for any trips I take in U.S. because they are so convenient. They have never leaked despite being thrown around everywhere including inside backpacks. The handle with clip is helpful for attaching to outside of bag for easy access. Very convenient that it rolls up to much smaller size when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Super lightweight and incredibly durable
customer_reviews.text: They’re perfect. They’re light. They’re durable. I’ve taken them a little over 30 miles now both on trail and off trail backpacking and left them on the outside of the pack. They’ve taken hits from branches. Being thrown around on my pack. Having my pack lay on top of them. Best of all one of them will hold an entire fifth of whiskey.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Had pin hole for new, and questionable durability. Not your primary water bottle.
customer_reviews.text: Just got a chance to use it this weekend on our first trip of the year to the AT. Light weight and easy enough to store and carry with you. The problem I had was my leg kept getting wet as we were hiking. I would stop, wipe the bottle off, tighten the lid again, and get back on the trail. After doing this several time in the first 30 minute, and upon further inspection, there was a pin hole in the side of it. Even if there was no hole in it, it would concern me know about durability. Don’t get it for your water bottle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor activities. Fantastic customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought these water bags for my paddle boards because they are super lightweight, large, and have carabiners. They are great for outdoor adventures. This company’s customer service is wonderful. They emailed me to make sure I received the package and everything was okay. Btw everything was great with the product and I’m very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Pensacola Pennyworth

customer_reviews.title: Work just fine
customer_reviews.text: They work well. You need to make sure the tops are screwed on tight or they will leak...I mean really screwed on tight. I thought I had them on tight and they leaked. This is not the case with my platypus collapsible canteens. But they worked well, the plastic is not the soft, silicone feel plastic like my platypus collapsible bottle that looks just like these. Can you tell I'm a bit bias and really like my platypus bottles?? But if you are on a budget, these worked just fine, no problems once you get the tops screwed on tight.
customer_reviews.author: Helen of Trout

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as Platypus
customer_reviews.text: These bottles are great. The rigid carabiner tab is why I purchased these. Platypus makes a model just like these for $16 a bottle. I've been hesitant on buying them until I saw these at a much better value. They are sealed well. I have no fear of them busting on me. Additionally, My Sawyer Squeeze Water Filter fits on them perfectly with no leaks. Sawyer's filters are great, but their bags are terrible. Buy these if you are looking for a well made bottle that you can trust to hold up during your days on the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: These are great for traveling. Getting them through airport security is a breeze (empty). They're a bit heavy and large when filled, but get smaller and lighter as you drink. And become incredibly portable when empty. Just at the 2 litter mark, it's perfect when water is a scarce comodity. Traveling through India and Thailand this canteen was one of the items that never left my day bag.
customer_reviews.author: El Monks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for use with Sawyer Mini water Filter.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly with the Sawyer Mini water filter. Will be getting more for the rest of the family. Think these are going to work well in a truck bag. They are stored empty and rolled, ready to fill before carrying the bag with water stored in the back of the vehicle. Two in each of the bags. And, the Sawyer Mini fits perfectly, BIG PLUS!!!
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Originally liked the product, but one tore in half where the plastic meets the spout while in the backcountry. Having equipment failures in the backcountry is not a good situation. I contacted the company and received excellent customer service. They are replacing the bottle, no questions asked, and with sincere apologies. Given their website and other reviews I am hopeful that I experienced an anomolous failure and that the replacement bottle will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Container
customer_reviews.text: Took out to the Sipsey Wilderness to do a 30 mile hike. The canteens did exactly as they should. They pack down to a small roll taking little room. The temp one night got to 23deg and the canteens hung on a gear line. No ill effect in the cold and still very flexible. Bet of all they have a Lifetime warranty!
customer_reviews.author: zann68

customer_reviews.title: ... one out with my survivor filter and it worked great! I like that it has the popup valve ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried one out with my survivor filter and it worked great! I like that it has the popup valve for using it as a canteen, and it sealed up well for forcing water through the filter! Nice tough material, these collapsible water bottles look like they will hold up for a long time, and they seal quite well to my Survivor Filter!
customer_reviews.author: Valued Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but hard to clean and fill because opening it's ...
customer_reviews.text: Great but hard to clean and fill because opening it's small. I wish they opened like a camel bak or something so I can clean and let it dry out Other than that they are great
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Time saver & Convienence
customer_reviews.text: Loved these bad bags out on the trails. The 32oz size is the way to go. I use the mini Saywer squeeze filter and these bags fill up my Smart water bottles uo in one go. Where as the Saywer bag that comes with is only 16oz so you would have to unscrew, fill, screw, filter 4 seperate times to fill 2 Smart water bottles. These Survivor Filter bags are awesome! Happy Trails🤙
customer_reviews.author: sivART

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking!
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with these canteens. I have a filter that I used for long, multi-day hikes, but it only came with a bag that was 16 ounces. These bags are the same gauge as the filter, and they are much larger that the bag that came with it. This helps me have more confidence in my supply of water while I'm on backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R. Bosch

customer_reviews.title: Most convenient water bottle
customer_reviews.text: We use these at Disney and they were perfect to drink from and pack away when done. Saves a lot of space in your bags. Easy to refill without any leaks or spills. Perfect for outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: The Bowmans

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Make Sure to Tighten the Caps!
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Seems durable. Make sure you tighten the caps all the way. I got these for my dog to carry in her dog backpack. I thought I had tightened the caps all the way but after a half mile my pup's pack was soaked. Home testing revealed the caps must be on very tight to avoid leaks, which was a little hard at first because these are not solid water bottles. With a little practice I had the caps consistently watertight. They will leak quickly if the caps are not on perfectly. Good product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: for the intended use a very good product. I do recommend specially for the long ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the strongest thing around but very light weight and space saving. Take care of them and they are very worth having. they are not "flimsy" but not a canteen either. for the intended use a very good product. I do recommend specially for the long hike. Carry one filled and others empty till you get to your campsite.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: a work in progress
customer_reviews.text: Since I have not used anything like this before, it is a learning process for me. They are sturdy but I have to figure out how to secure them in my backpack. I also have to remember to secure the lids on good.
customer_reviews.author: R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for filling up and keeping in our mini fridge on recent cruise trip. We stayed hydrated, easy to clean, easy to transport around without them taking up a lot of space or adding any weight.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie sshrewby

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and compacts nicely after use!
customer_reviews.text: Product came in on time, complete when expected. I bought two and just recently used them in fairly cold weather. Very durable and collapsible. One even froze solid by morning and still working strong. Very impressive. I'll definitely be buying a few more. -Reed
customer_reviews.author: Reed Page

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: Good idea; liked ability to just roll up when empty and not in use. However, filled, it was leaky and could not tighten cap sufficiently to stop the leak. Besides, shouldn't have to struggle with it. So, good idea; glad I tried it, but had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Zev B.

customer_reviews.title: What a great idea!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a 10 day trip to Europe; we didn't need any filters, just something that collapses for day trips. We've already taken them out a second time for a weekend in Philly. You can literally roll these up and put them in your pocket. No funny plastic taste with one day's use. If you're hiking or camping, I bet these would be even more practical.
customer_reviews.author: bambooroof

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Seem durable. Light weight. Nice that it has 2 in package. Standard cap size and threads, can use Coke caps for replacement. Fits Sawyer and Hydroblu filters.
customer_reviews.author: WV Smoke

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to your hiking gear.
customer_reviews.text: These bottles worked fine. I used them on a one day Grand Canyon Rim-Rim hike to carry electrolytes. They supplemented my Camelbak beautifully. No taste from the bottle materials. The only observation I would make was that I was looking for something between 0.5 and 1.0 liters as I felt a full one liter bottle would be too heavy. That said, I just did not fill the bottle to the top, so no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Philip T.

customer_reviews.title: Spreading the weight to each crew member proved much better than the traditiona 2 or 3 liter water bags ...
customer_reviews.text: Had a Crew of 12 Scouts on 12 day backpack trip. Placed two with each person to carry cooking water when we would be in a dry camp area. Water containers were very lite weight and took little room in packs when empty. Spreading the weight to each crew member proved much better than the traditiona 2 or 3 liter water bags we see most people caring by hand when they need to transport water to a dry camp.
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: So Happy I Purchased
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for a recent trip to Amsterdam, and they were such a life saver! A superior experience to carrying around a plastic water bottle, and very easy to use. One of the clips broke halfway into the trip, and when I emailed the seller for a replacement clip, they quickly sent me two new canteens. Great customer service, unbeatable price and superior product. Will definitely shop this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it can hold up to quite a bit of use. I bought it for my Sawyer Mini, and it is way better quality than the Sawyer's original bags. Still have to put it to the real test on a few big hikes (only used it a few times to date), but I trust it will hold up really well
customer_reviews.author: Snyman

customer_reviews.title: Great for trips and Cruise excursions
customer_reviews.text: Bought these water bottles to take with me on a cruise so we could use them on excursions. They worked fantastic. They fit perfectly in the bags my family brought and held a lot of water.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony West

customer_reviews.title: The Highest Quality
customer_reviews.text: These canteens, like everything else they make, are of the highest quality. The material is thicker and the seam welds are very durable. They are rigid enough to stand open while empty to facilitate air drying which helps for long term storage. And as they are transparent you have a better idea of how effective your filter is.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Not so useful for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking they'd be good emergency water containers, but was very disappointed. They are rather cumbersome to handle, and nearly impossible to clean and especially to dry (I hung them upside down on a wooden plastic bag/bottle dryer to keep them from collapsing, but it didn't work very well)
customer_reviews.author: Movie Watcher

customer_reviews.title: Not really reliable
customer_reviews.text: The tops leak on 2 of the 4 bottles I bought. They work ok if I make sure they’re upright in my pack, but I think next time I’ll go back to Platypus.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great little canteens!
customer_reviews.text: I always worry that these are not durable, but these came and I was surprised. I bought 3 sets and gave one to each of my family members for their earthquake kits. I also love that they are BPA free and you don't have to worry about toxic chemicals leaking into our water. I will update if anything changes. Happy Shopping!
customer_reviews.author: Perla

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Light, easy to wash, easy to handle, Filling is a breeze with the canteens ability to stand on its own, Simply brilliant. Drying and storage cinch. Carried 4 canteens in my backpack on their side along with other items. No leaks. The biggest concern so far is the ability to apply the lid tightly. It takes more effort than anticipated. Only other concern: Made in China. Not with USA plastics.
customer_reviews.author: Poingdexter

customer_reviews.title: So I didn't know it had basic filters but happy that it did.
customer_reviews.text: Got two pairs for our BOBs wife's and mine. Work great fill and go. Pretty strong carabiners and handles help and gives options.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and perfect for dirty bags
customer_reviews.text: Took these on a 4 day backpacking trip for "just in case" senarios and they came in handy for emergency water filtration. The bags are sturdy enough that I wasn't too worried about tossing a full bag on the ground after filling it is at a water source. Will buy these again if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! Needed lightweight dishes after a major spinal surgery and these were perfect! Still use them everyday!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Bag/Canteen Alternative!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Who would think you could get so excited about a "collapsible" canteen, buy the developers of this product put a lot of thought into its design and into its manufacture. Makes a perfect emergency canteen for storage in your vehicle or BOB. It is light but still very durable. When you can't or don't have a regular canteen or water bladder, this is the next best thing!
customer_reviews.author: lmg

customer_reviews.title: amazing product...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time trying out canteens since a friend told me to pack lightly for the camping trip, and I have to admit, these are pretty cool! They seal tightly and securely, so no worries about this leaking in my bag. Also, the filter will definitely come handy for unreliable water sources!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great for our dogs water!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for what we wanted, we take these on our hikes with our Labs and they are just the right amount of water for them. And when done they fold right with no extra trash.
customer_reviews.author: Lissa Cano

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Won't stand up
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Won't stand up, drips and leaks constantly, one came with a broken cap. Not recommended at all- wish I hadn't wasted my money
customer_reviews.author: Trimble

customer_reviews.title: Flexible and durable--easy to handle and use
customer_reviews.text: I bought the canteens to use on a trip to Cuba. They proved to be flexible and durable. My Sawyer Mini Filter fit perfectly. The larger capacity made refilling some of our purchased water bottles much easier. Back from the trip, they will be added to my BOB.
customer_reviews.author: madclark

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip to Costa Rica and am glad I did. They hold 1 liter of water and are easily refillable. They also fold/roll away for easy storage and do not take up much room! They fit in my backpack well and the carabiner clip allows for the water bottles to clip on the outside of a backpack. Again, these are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: IV

customer_reviews.title: It it nice to have these to keep unfiltered water distinct from ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is extremely helpful for filtering water fast through the Survivor Filter. they do actually fit into their clasp when rolled, which makes them stay compact during travel. I was using them in flowing water, and at first I was having difficulty filling the canteen up more than 1/3 to 1/2 way. Which I could have filtered that amount and started again. I got it to fill all the way up by just blowing into it. It it nice to have these to keep unfiltered water distinct from filtered water.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Payne

customer_reviews.title: Good product... except it won’t dry out inside.
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly like it is advertised to. However, when you wash it and hang it up to dry, it does not seem to do so. I have had mine hanging up since my camping trip four days ago and it is still drying. If it were not for that I would give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because they seemed like the best value for water storage. I put one in either side my dog's pack when we go backpacking. In the 5-months of light backpacking use, we never abused these but one started leaking on our last outing. Build quality definitely isn't up to platypus level, but these are cheaper. Purchase accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Brook

customer_reviews.title: Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the product to carry with me on an overseas hiking trip and for wilderness travel next year. I like that the bottles fold down flat for easy carrying in luggage when flying or when backpacking/camping. I haven't tried/purchased the filter attachment, but may do so for my wilderness trip next year (I usually carry a pump filter with me, but they are bulky and somewhat inconvenient).
customer_reviews.author: Randy C

customer_reviews.title: Great and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: As a cross country cyclist, there are always times when you know that water might be scarce between towns or campsites. My normal XC bike carries 4 1 liter bottles on the forks, but sometimes more is better. I bought these to stick in my frame bag or hang from an internal strap in my backpack. The included carabiners make them that much more useful. Great product and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: bakerjw

customer_reviews.title: I saw how useful it would be for anyone
customer_reviews.text: I bought the water filter together with the canteens because I saw how useful it would be for anyone. I totally love how big the canteens are. It can hold more water than other canteens I've ever owned. Plus, with the water filter with it, any water source can be used for drinking. It's something you can definitely make use of during any emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: Disposable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these awhile ago so maybe it just has a shelf life but both leaked from the seams after the second or third use. It does seem too thin for long term storage and/or use .
customer_reviews.author: FR

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than Nalgene
customer_reviews.text: Simple liter bottles that are light and easy to use. I got them free when I ordered the filter from Survivor Filter, but they worked great in carrying an extra liter of water on the trail. The clip also helps if you want to hang off bag or put in side pocket and don't want to risk it falling out. Will recommend if you're looking for cheap extra water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: These are for my Get Home Bag Currently they are ...
customer_reviews.text: These are for my Get Home Bag Currently they are just waiting for when I need to fill them with water before hitting the road. They look tough and accept my water filter. Under my desk at work is a 1 gallon water jug because when it happens there won't be any water running so I'll transfer it to these.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Bass

customer_reviews.title: ... them on a weekend hiking trip and they did great! We loved clipping them full onto the bags ...
customer_reviews.text: Took them on a weekend hiking trip and they did great! We loved clipping them full onto the bags or rolling them small when empty. Unfortunately, we may have lost a rolled empty one, but we had already planned to buy more. Fit the Sawyer Squeeze system, which is why I bought them. We ended up using these for our clean water, but I tested it with the Squeeze and it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bigham

customer_reviews.title: "for my camping trip"
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my camping trip with friends. Love how something so small like this water filter can really clean the heck out of any type of water. Tested it on the water I got from a river and wasn't really expecting much, but I love that it didn't have any weird taste. Super tasted clean to me.
customer_reviews.author: Idle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Arrived fast and is very durable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Arrived fast and is very durable. Will buy again 10/10 also I was contacted by the seller who just wanted to ensure I was satisfied with the product which I am, to me that is a good show of customer service and exceptional reflection of company values. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: bruce

customer_reviews.title: Very nice water bottles!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great value. I don't have the filter, but they work great as water bottles for inside my backpack. I just do not like the bulk of rigid bottles in my pack. These are perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: KandyTrip

customer_reviews.title: These collapsible canteens went right into my "bug-out" bag. ...
customer_reviews.text: These collapsible canteens went right into my "bug-out" bag. I live in earthquake country and you never know when you might have to grab the kids and run out of the house if it starts to shake. "Water" is often available in disaster situations, but is it CLEAN? Do you have anything to CARRY it in? Important questions, especially as hurricane season starts on the East Coast.
customer_reviews.author: BonnieBTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Used on a bike trip. These were great. Carried e tea water in them. Never leaked. Great for packing since they are flat.
customer_reviews.author: ETVL

customer_reviews.title: It served its purpose and was very useful
customer_reviews.text: The product was good, and the price was great. We used this for an international trip, loading up with water at the hotel and using it throughout the day, it was convenient to latch on to any bag or backpack, and even more convenient to roll up into a bag once it was empty. It’s lightweight so even once empty, your not carrying around a big bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalia

customer_reviews.title: good for just a quick
customer_reviews.text: Not meant for long trek or hacking trips.. the leaked at the lid seam.. good for just a quick walk
customer_reviews.author: Brenda R

customer_reviews.title: At N2NGO Disaster Response we love them
customer_reviews.text: These bottles are light, strong and we can carry many of them in a small place. Great to distribute to survivors.
customer_reviews.author: C. Chiossone

customer_reviews.title: They require small storage space when they are rolled and they're a great addition to your extra drinking water supply when you'
customer_reviews.text: We got this as extra hydration packs for our bags. They require small storage space when they are rolled and they're a great addition to your extra drinking water supply when you're going to a hiking or backpacking trip. We have the survival filter and both of them work wonderfully. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DayahSTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Just like drinking out of a regular water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I thought it actually had an actual "filter" in the mouth piece but there isn't one. Just like drinking out of a regular water bottle. I got it because of the carabiner to attach to my roller bag for travel but it's awkward that way so i don't do. Still easy way to carry 33 oz of water.
customer_reviews.author: Keri Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Great for transport
customer_reviews.text: These canteens are great for transport. When not in use they can fold up nicely and be stored away. They hold a decent amount of water and are made with durability in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Holy smokes were these an awesome buy. I don't camp so I didn't use ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy smokes were these an awesome buy. I don't camp so I didn't use them that way, but I did use them to carry water/juice around Disneyland and on multiple theme park trips so I wouldn't have to carry bottles or hit water fountains for my toddler. They never leaked and they are so easy to clean. My husband and I will definitely purchase these again. They're very durable and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jolie Colin

customer_reviews.title: These are great canteens which can be used with the Sawyer Mini
customer_reviews.text: These are great canteens which can be used with the Sawyer Mini. You can use one for drinking and one for dirty water with the two different colored carabiners (red and blue). A good buy!
customer_reviews.author: The cat lady

customer_reviews.title: Nice simple fold up canteens.
customer_reviews.text: Two nice little canteen/bags with spouts to sip from. Fits my Sawyer water filter and will be my drinking water bottles? D-rings with small, inexpensive carabiner to hanget them from a belt or backpack or just about anything. I will let you know how ell they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Soft Sided Water Bottle
customer_reviews.text: Love these little guys. I use them to have water with me while I am skiing. I drink a ton of water. These are soft so if I happen to fall I won't break a rib. I can fill them part way and keep them in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: S. H.

customer_reviews.title: great lightweight canteen
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly what I thought it was. Like the different color carabiner for his/her canteen. It also fits with my Sawyer water filter too. great capacity. Will be purchasing another set soon.
customer_reviews.author: Myron Kidd

customer_reviews.title: I love these. I don't know why I bothered to ...
customer_reviews.text: Man, I love these. I don't know why I bothered to use hard bottles or canteens all these years. Fold away after you empty them making for easy storage and less weight. I sewed up some nice sleeves to protect them from punctures and they work great
customer_reviews.author: Franklin R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Love the small to large profile of this product. It fits easy into travel cases past TSA & fills easily. Would be nice if it could stay cooler longer is only suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Rzeszutko

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the Individual
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in conjunction with two (2) individual Survivor Filter systems for my wife and I. I researched this Survivor Filter product independent of the Amazon reviews and found that it has good reviews elsewhere. (BTW, I have a Pelican Whole House water filter, Carbon system, for my well at home.)
customer_reviews.author: William Wilder

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing product. The water bags fit perfectly on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. The water bags fit perfectly on the survivor filter. Nice for hiking and very little weight. Used the package filter and bags all weekend on a kayak camping trip bringing only the filter and its bags. Healthy and happy still.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Keep these in my truck along with my Survivor filter ...
customer_reviews.text: Keep these in my truck along with my Survivor filter in case I get stranded due to weather or a break down. since the bags are collapsible, you can keep both bags and the filtration system rolled up in your gloves compartment with plenty of room to spare for your usual items. Obviously they would be just as handy on the trail or at a campsite as a back up canteen.
customer_reviews.author: Moises

customer_reviews.title: Great product, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product, especially for the price. Took these to a five day Rock festival in the UK and they survived through days of mosh Pits strapped to the outside of my bag. Convenient for the airport too. They did finally crack at the creases from folding and packing and temperature exposure after another half dozen camping trips in the Colorado mountains. Looking to aquire more to try out the attachments!
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Stiff Plastic
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like these, but I wish the plastic was softer like the platypus bags.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Got to use these the day after I got them in. Everything was as described and they are strong. We went on a weekend hike 40 miles on the Appalachian Trail and I used them both with no problems. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Keasters

customer_reviews.title: Great product and customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I really love how much lighter these are than the traditional Nalgene bottles for backpacking. They also work well when your pack is full and the side pockets are difficult to slip a normal bottle into. After a couple summers I had a leak in one of the bottles and Survivor promptly refunded my order and sent me a new set no questions asked. They stand by their product and I'll definitely buy more things from them in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: First impression is light weight but probably not too durable due to being plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Just received these free as part of a deal when purchasing the filter. First impressions of them are they aren't very durable being plastic. They are light weight and look to hold a decent amount if water. A plus and a minus for backpacking. I will admit that I have not used them or the filter yet due to it being winter and not backpacking season. Will update when I can get out and field test.
customer_reviews.author: CyDoran

product_meta.title: Survivor Filter Collapsible Canteens (33oz) 2 Pack (2L Total) - Durable Carabiners and Handles. Squeeze Water Through a Filter or Use as Water Bottles. Light and BPA Free.
feature_bullets: SCREWS INTO YOUR SURVIVOR FILTER Allows you to Squeeze Clean Water through your Survivor Filter with Ease.
ULTRA STURDY CARABINERS AND HANDLES: The Survivor Filter Collapsible Canteens are 33 ounces (1 litre) each and allow you to quick fill from any Fresh Water Source.

BPA FREE AND EASY TO CLEAN: It’s also Eco-Friendly, Reusable and Refillable. Comes with a Push-Pull Cap to Protect the Mouthpiece from Dirt and Damage. Saves Space and is the Perfect Addition to your Survivor Filter in your Bug-Out-Bag.
STANDS UPRIGHT AS A WATER BOTTLE WHEN FILLED: Lightweight and Easy to Carry. Can be Folded, Rolled up, Flattened or Attached to your Survivor Filter or Backpack.

SURVIVOR FILTER LIFETIME WARRANTY: Survivor Filter is based in North America and we cover all manufacturing and other defects with our Lifetime Warranty. If you ever run into any problems with any of our products simply contact us and we will work to make it right.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
